title: The Flame In The Darkness
opening: A pattern of strange occurrences in Remire Village has suddenly erupted into something far more serious.

dialogue.speaker: Hubert
dialogue.line: You look unwell. It's because of what happened, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Don't speak of it aloud.

dialogue.speaker: Hubert
dialogue.line: You can't change the past. For now, all we can do is use it to our advantage.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: I know that. I also know that I must steel myself to ascend the Imperial throne.

dialogue.speaker: Hubert
dialogue.line: Those preparations are going well. We... Someone is coming.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Professor, I heard about our mission for this month. Something terrible is happening in Remire Village. That's where you were when fate sent you our way. This feels...preordained.

dialogue.speaker: Hubert
dialogue.line: Are the knights making progress with their investigation?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: They are.

dialogue.speaker: Hubert
dialogue.line: If what is happening there is by design, there must be someone pulling the strings. There is the Death Knight, of course. And the mysterious mages who were implicated with the Western Church. They showed up when Flayn was kidnapped as well. And now there is another strange occurrence near the monastery... It seems an unknown organization hopes to make the monastery its stage for something.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Do you believe that all of these incidents are connected, Professor?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I do.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: That is the logical conclusion, but I'm not so sure.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I do not.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Oh? I'm surprised to hear you say that, but actually, I agree.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: It certainly appears that all of the events surrounding the monastery are connected by a single thread. However... I think it's possible that it may just be a result of different motives overlapping. Remember, Professor... If you think of people as simply enemies or allies, it may be impossible to grasp the truth.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: I see. So you'll be staying here for some time, then. Honestly, I'm surprised. I've heard it's been a few years since you last donated to the church.

dialogue.speaker: Lord Arundel
dialogue.line: That was merely because of the financial situation of my territory. I assure you, it has nothing to do with my dedication to the church. By the way, Dimitri... Isn't Edelgard currently enrolled at the Officers Academy as well?

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Yes. She's in the Black Eagle House. I don't believe she has any plans to leave anytime soon. Why not pay her a visit?

dialogue.speaker: Lord Arundel
dialogue.line: I may do just that. It's nice to stay in touch with my dear niece every now and then. Of course I'm also delighted that I was able to speak with my nephew, as well. Whether through marriage or otherwise, family is family, after all.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Of course. The feeling is mutual.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Professor... If you were watching, you should have made your presence known.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Who was that?

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: That was Lord Arundel, the Regent for the Empire. He is also Edelgard's uncle.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: An acquaintance of yours?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: He called you his nephew...

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: My stepmother was his younger sister. We are not related by blood, but he is technically my uncle.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: In other words...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: So, you and Edelgard...

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Yes. My stepmother was Edelgard's birth mother. Edelgard and I are siblings by marriage. We can delve into that topic another time. For now, let's make preparations to investigate what's happening in that village.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Oh dear. The princess of the Empire and the Kingdom's prince are kin! How very odd.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: So that's why he was worried about her...

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: All beings are attached somehow to those who are their family. Yes...even I. I must have had a family too... I wish I could remember them. My family... I wonder who and where they are, and what they're doing now.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I find it odd as well...

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: They likely harbor knowledge they do not wish to share. Oh yes, I'm sure of it. But I suppose we must wait until the time of truth arrives...

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: In any case... About this Arundel. You've heard that name before, correct?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: In the library.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Quite true! We came across that name within the library, right where the prince had been.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: In the office.

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: Your memory is worse than mine! The library! We came across that name within the library, right where the prince had been. Don't you recall?

dialogue.speaker: Sothis
dialogue.line: I thought that Arundel had died... And yet, not so. He seems alive and well. I wonder what the prince had hoped to learn from reading of his uncle's charity... So many things the prince has yet to tell... How bothersome...

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Tomas doesn't seem to be here... Oh well, that's fine. I've been researching the Heroes' Relics a lot since we last spoke to him. I found out something interesting.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Why have you been researching them?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Why? Do you have to ask? Trust me, what really matters is what I found out.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Something interesting?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: It's about the connection between Crests and the Heroes' Relics. The Crest Stone of each Relic is carved with a specific Crest-the one that has the ability to wield it properly. The Crests are the keys. You need the right one to safely use a Hero's Relic. The only thing I can't figure out is...why doesn't the Sword of the Creator have a Crest Stone bearing a Crest?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: It's by the whim of the goddess.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Hey, now! No need to write off my findings by saying it's a mere whim of the goddess.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: It had one in the past.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Precisely. At least, that's my current guess.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: There's more. I believe the Crest Stones might be the source of the Relics' inhuman power. When Miklan transformed into a Black Beast, he was taken over by something that originated from the Crest Stone. And the Crest Stone was on his body. It all seems to add up. Now, look at this picture I found in the library.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: That creature is called the Immaculate One, who was supposedly sent by the goddess to save the followers of Seiros. See the pattern on its brow, and the faint circular boundary? Isn't it possible that's a Crest Stone? If all this is true, then Crest Stones are what power the ability to assume massive forms like that of the Immaculate One. And maybe the Heroes' Relics can harness that transformative power...

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Oh. It is you. Have you seen Tomas recently?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: No such luck. I was hoping to speak with him myself, but he seems to be out on the town.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I see. Well... Hm?! Where did you find that picture?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: It was in the library. Why do you ask? Is it something my youthful eyes shouldn't be seeing?

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: No, of course not. However, that is not part of this library's collection. It must belong to Tomas. It would be problematic if it got mixed in with the other books. I will take possession of it for now.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Take it away where no one can see it, you mean...

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: What was that?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: That's what Tomas said. He said records that the monastery doesn't approve of tend to disappear.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Tomas said that? Preposterous. I have far too much to accomplish to waste time with this foolishness.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: He was certainly in a hurry. I wonder if he's off to confront Tomas. Well, he took the picture, so I guess that's that for now. I'll see you later, Teach.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: So, the church is hiding something after all. Some massive secret about Relics and Crests. A secret that must have something to do with the professor's true identity...

conversation.speaker: Sothis
conversation.line: I do not know why it is so, but being here makes me feel quite...unwell. I am so sleepy...and a bit... It is a struggle merely to stay conscious... Are you feeling the same?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I am.

conversation.speaker: Sothis
conversation.line: And yet, it feels familiar... As though pulled from a corner of my memory, from a time long ago... I simply cannot fathom it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I am not.

conversation.speaker: Sothis
conversation.line: Why must you be so difficult! I know the entire contents of your heart and soul, so you should know there is no fooling me!

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: They say that things rarely if ever go according to plan. Still, plan we must. After all, if we don't effectively force things to go our way, nothing will be achieved. How about you, Professor? Are you leading the life you envisioned for yourself?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I am.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Your character must be stronger than most.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I am not.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: That's surprising... but I suppose it's possible you're telling the truth.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: They say that things rarely if ever go according to plan. Still, plan we must. After all, if we don't effectively force things to go our way, nothing will be achieved. How about you, Professor? Are you leading the life you envisioned for yourself?

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: I'm sorry to ask this of you...but I would deeply appreciate it if you would promise to keep my association with Edelgard to yourself. It is a...complicated history, what she and I share.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: Professor, you seem unwell. How are you faring? If you're not feeling well, I'd strongly recommend some rest.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Even if I spend all my time rummaging through this library, there's a limit to the knowledge that can be gained. Apparently, it only contains books whose contents have been deemed appropriate by the church. If only Tomas were around. I bet he has some interesting stories he could regale us with…

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: What in the world is happening in Remire Village? I hear even the knights have been dispatched. I hope it's nothing too serious… After all, that's where we first met. I have valued memories of that place.

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: Need something, Professor? I was just asking Monica here to be less demanding of Lady Edelgard's time.

conversation.speaker: Monica
conversation.line: Hey, it's not like I'm bothering her! Sorry for the ruckus, Professor. Please don't worry about it too much. Nooothing to worry about here!

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: Ugh. I wish you would worry about it a little more.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Remire Village... Is that not where you met Edelgard? If you had not been there, something terrible could have happened. Did one of the house leaders know that mercenaries were staying in Remire Village? I wonder... It will remain a mystery for now. All we can do at this point is speculate.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: I fear I may become a social recluse soon... My life consists of wearing a groove in the floor between the library and the dining hall. Although, I guess a real recluse wouldn't leave their room, eh? That would be me if you weren't my teacher, locked away in my room, reading napping, never to be seen. You know I never see Bernadetta outside of class. I wonder what it is that she does in her room all day.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: I fear I may become a social recluse soon... My life consists of wearing a groove in the floor between the library and the dining hall. Although, I guess a real recluse wouldn't leave their room, eh?

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Hey, Professor. Did you see that my father came by during the Battle of the Eagle and Lion? He left soon after, but I saw him talking to Edelgard first. I wonder what they could have to talk about.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Your father?

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Yeah, he's pretty important in the Empire. I thought I mentioned it to you before? He's the Minister of Military Affairs.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Empire business, perhaps?

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: I guess that would make sense. He is the Minister of Military Affairs, after all.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Still though... I could've sworn those two didn't get along.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: What is it? Sorry, I've, um... I've got a cold.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Get well soon.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Um. Thanks.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: No, you don't.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: How did you know? My act was perfect. Alas, 'tis no mere illness of the body, but a malign affliction of mine soul! So, um, back to bed.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Congratulations on winning the Battle of the Eagle and Lion. Did you get a special reward? I certainly feel like I earned a special reward. Don't you, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: No. Winning is its own reward.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: I was afraid you might say that. I do wish you'd dote on me just a bit more...

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Aww... Disappointing.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: This is a place of mysteriousness. I have awareness of how much difference every part of the world is. In a place alike to this place, you can imagine the goddess of Fódlan truly existing. At times, I miss those places in Brigid. At times... I am missing those places so painfully.

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: All this month, His Highness has been going out late into the night. He will not speak of it to me. Professor, do you happen to know anything?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: As I recall...

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: Lord Arundel is here? That may well explain it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't know.

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: I see. I am sorry to trouble you with questions.

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: His Highness's headaches have been growing steadily worse. I would prefer that he retire to bed early.

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: Investigating Remire village? Be on your guard.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: You know, Professor–the tournament fish, and the meal we indulged in after the Battle of the Eagle and Lion... Why, all of the food I've eaten in this monastery has been absolutely delectable. Every last bite of it.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Food really is the only thing you think about, huh?

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Hardly! I think about all sorts of things.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Oh! Like tomorrow's menu, for instance?

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: I'm worried about Remire. That affliction is a little too mysterious for my liking. I'm pretty sure it's not normal.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I've heard it's not an ordinary disease.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: Then what could it be?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I've heard it's the work of a cursed specter.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: Wh-what?! Ah! Come on, don't tease me. But what if it really was something like that? How could we hope to stop it?

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: I wonder how Remire Village is faring. Hopefully we're not dealing with some new epidemic. It wouldn't be unheard of. Almost 20 years ago, a terrible plague blazed through Faerghus. It even hit the capital city, taking the queen consort's life...or so I heard. The whole Kingdom was in an uproar over that loss. The person who saved the Kingdom wasn't a doctor but a holy woman–the fair Lady Cornelia. After that, she was awarded the honor of being a mage in the service of the royal family. She sounds like an amazing woman, but... She must be pretty old by now. But hey, maybe she's aged like a fine wine.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Oh, goodness. Is something the matter, Professor? You look a little pale... Please be careful. It's so easy to catch a cold this time of year.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Hmm... The librarian is always out and about these days. And just when I had some questions about a book I'd borrowed... Ugh, now I'm so curious about where he's gone off to! He'd better come back soon...

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: How are you feeling, Professor? You look rather ill, if you don't mind my saying so. Are you sick? If so, I would urge you not to push yourself too hard. Take some rest.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Nothing gets by you.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: Just my natural talent. Nothing out of the ordinary. Enough wit, now. You should lie down.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: What an unexpected kindness.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: What is that supposed to mean? Never mind. If you're not feeling well, you should stop trying to walk it off and simply lie down.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Hey, Professor. Can I get your advice on something? I just don't know what to do anymore. I used to think they were the best, but now I can't even stand looking at them!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It's OK to be worried.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: But worrying about it won't solve my problems! What if I can never eat fish again?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Time heals all wounds.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Good point, Professor. I think I need to see other meats right now. Then I can come back to fish when I'm good and ready!

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: Ah, Professor! The Battle of the Eagle and Lion was such good fun, don't you think?

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Ignatz, how long are you going to keep harping on about the Battle of the Eagle and Lion?

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: Aw, come on, let me gush! Did you see how the house leaders came together after the battle? What an incredible thing to witness! Harmony, even after something so hard-fought.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: True. If they can keep playing nice, perhaps there will be peace in Fódlan after all.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: I heard about Remire Village from some of the knights. It's certainly troubling. If it's a contagion, we at Garreg Mach should be on the lookout as well.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't believe it is.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Oh? Well, that's better, but I wonder what the real cause could be... Your words are oddly persuasive, Professor. Even if they're not exactly based on anything.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'll handle it.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Your words are oddly persuasive, Professor. Even if they're not exactly based on anything.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Good day, Professor. Well then, I should go.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Professor! Captain Jeralt just told me. Remire Village is in a bad way, right?

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: The situation there is worrying, yes... But tell me, how is your vertigo?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm all right now.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Were you not feeling OK? You seem fine to me.

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: I hope you're not just saying that. We can't have you putting on a brave face only to fall in battle.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Still a little unsteady.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Are you not feeling OK? You should get some rest!

conversation.speaker: Jeralt
conversation.line: Hm. If you must go to the village, make sure you're in good health before we depart.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: Professor... Do you ever wish you could return to your life as a mercenary?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I do.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: I thought you might. Traveling the world, just you and Jeralt... How lovely it must have been.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I do not.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: Is that so? I suppose you have become accustomed to your new line of work. This month's assignment will again take you outside of Garreg Mach...to Remire Village.

conversation.speaker: Rhea
conversation.line: It was in Remire that you first met Alois and the rest of his order, was it not? Half a year has come and gone since then. How quickly time passes...

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: What is it? I am in the middle of my daily duties. I assume you know by now that the Four Saints are all important figures in the teachings of Seiros... Still, I have a particular fondness for Saint Cethleann.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: I am so happy to be part of your class, Professor. I honestly cannot recall the last time I interacted with others on a daily basis like this... It reminds me of when I was a child. Ha, that was so very long ago now...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: How long ago?

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Oh, I mean, very. Very, very, very long ago.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You're still a child.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Despite how young I may appear to you, I'm quite mature. You may be surprised, you know.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: I'm going to catch me some mighty fish, just you wait and see! I didn't catch a single fish last month. But this month! This month!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Time to give up.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: That's exactly what Captain Jeralt said!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Maybe you're doing something wrong?

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: I'm casting my line just as the captain taught me all those years ago...

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: You're going with the captain to investigate Remire Village, aren't you? It feels like so long ago that you two came here...

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: Of the four or five years since I started here, this is certainly the busiest.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: It was four. I've been here five.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: Oh, what's a year here or there? Don' t be petty now, Shamir.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: You count your enemies the same way.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: If I take care of them quickly, what does it matter how many there are? Oh, sorry! We didn't mean to ignore you, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: As you were saying, it's been a busy year. There never seem to be enough hands for the work.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: That reminds me, do you have that thing? If you do, we want it.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: Want? No. We need it. Give it to me, not her.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: Hey now, I'm the one who brought it up. We may be friends, but that's just rude.

conversation.speaker: Gilbert
conversation.line: Professor? Tell me, is this about Remire? There are more villagers acting strangely today than yesterday. Knights have been dispatched, yet... The underlying cause is as yet unclear, and the most anyone can do is stand back and watch. It is most distressing. Professor, what do you think about all this?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Some kind of illness.

conversation.speaker: Gilbert
conversation.line: If it were indeed a disease, why would it only affect the villagers, and not infect the knights stationed there?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Some kind of conspiracy.

conversation.speaker: Gilbert
conversation.line: In that case, we should strengthen the guards. If you visit the village, Professor, please...take care.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Punishment from the goddess.

conversation.speaker: Gilbert
conversation.line: The goddess?! You have spoken near blasphemy, and I would suggest a hasty apology!

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: I thought we might make it through last month in peace, but no. Another incident just had to arise, didn't it? If only this debacle had to do with Crests. Why, I'd have gone and dealt with it in an instant.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: I know you figure medicine and magical healing are two ways to do the same thing, but it's way deeper than that. Medicine is all about preventing infection and suppressing symptoms with, well, medicine... That's probably obvious. But magical healing is focused on closing up wounds faster, raising a body's vital energy, stuff like that.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: The knights go out from Garreg Mach to take on all kinds of other duties. I'd sure like a job like that one day. Then again, I don't know... Serving Lady Rhea here is pretty good.

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Oh, except that Tomas departed the monastery and is yet to return. Consider that reported. He's been gone for periods of time before and has always returned, so I'm not too worried. Still... I wonder what in the world he's doing out there!

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: We've got to go. Now.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What's going on?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: OK.

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: The situation in Remire Village has changed drastically. We don't know much more than that. We're hearing reports that the villagers are killing each other. Some say houses are burning. Regardless, we need to move.

intro.speaker: Rampaging Villager
intro.line: Kill! Kill! Ahhhh!

intro.speaker: Rampaging Villager
intro.line: Haha... Hahaha... Hrngyarhh!

intro.speaker: Village Child
intro.line: Help! Somebody, please help!

intro.speaker: Jeralt
intro.line: What's going on here...

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: This is horrific. It's even more revolting...more terrible than I expected.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'm revolted too.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: It really is horrifying.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: True, but if we are not careful how we proceed, we will only increase the death toll.

intro.speaker: Caspar
intro.line: The villagers are all attacking each other! Let's knock them all out, one by one!

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: Always so reckless. You do know that if we mess up, we will either kill or be killed, right?

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: Still, we cannot just stand here twiddling our thumbs and doing nothing!

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: I'd r-really like to go home now...but there's no time for thoughts like that.

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: We have to help them!

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: I am waiting for your orders with full readiness.

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: Wait. Those people over there... They seem to be observing the chaos. They must be behind this. Eliminate them and rescue all of the unafflicted villagers.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Ungh...

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What's wrong with you?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Are you OK?

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: I... Don't worry about me. I'm fine.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Don't waste your time on me. Saving the village is far more important. We haven't a moment to lose!

intro.speaker: Dedue
intro.line: What can we do amidst such confusion?

intro.speaker: Felix
intro.line: We'll have to take up arms against the villagers who are rampaging. If we strike carefully, it should be possible to spare their lives.

intro.speaker: Mercedes
intro.line: Oh dear... Isn't there a more peaceful way to deal with this?

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: No matter how long it takes, we'll need to check and rescue them all, one at a time.

intro.speaker: Ashe
intro.line: Those who have gone made may be victims themselves. Is it possible to save them?

intro.speaker: Annette
intro.line: Well, saving the poor people who aren't crazy is definitely our top priority! Let's get on with it!

intro.speaker: Sylvain
intro.line: Slow down, Annette. It won't do anyone any good if we panic and get injured ourselves.

intro.speaker: Dedue
intro.line: Isn't that... Your Highness. Suspicious figures spotted in the village. They seem to be...watching the chaos.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Are they the ones responsible for this madness? If so...it's clear what must be done. Kill them all. Don't let a single one of them escape. Sever their limbs and crush their wicked skulls!

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: This is unbelievable... There's no way to tell who's lost their mind from who's mad with fear...

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: If we don't act quickly, things are just going to keep getting worse!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: It's horrifying.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: I really don't want to get involved here...but we can't leave these people on their own, right?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What can we do?

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: How about we hit them hard enough to knock them out, but not hard enough to kill them?

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: That's too reckless! But... I'll admit, I can't think of a better option.

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: If some must die, just know it was by the will of the goddess...

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Stop that, Marianne! We have to save all of them. There's no way this madness is by the will of the goddess!

intro.speaker: Lorenz
intro.line: Nobles are responsible for the safety of commoners. By the honor of House Gloucester, I swear that I will save them all.

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: Claude. There are some strange-looking people here.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: So you noticed too. Look. There's a suspicious group hiding amongst the villagers. Could they be the culprits? If so...

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: They will not be forgiven.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I won't let them escape.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: There you have it. Our objective is clear. Take down that suspicious group and rescue the villagers.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: The Death Knight was just a distraction. Let's concentrate on killing Solon.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: We let him get away... That doesn't matter now. Our top priority is to kill Solon!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: What does he want, anyway? In any case, we need to take care of Solon!

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: My pleasure... Do your best to kill me with that blade...

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: You are not the one I crave...

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: My blade craves their flesh... The weak will eventually die...

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: What are you trying to do here?

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: You're the one who should be answering that question. Stay out of my way!

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: You did well handling that awful business in Remire Village. I am certain the goddess shares in our grief at the senselessness of that calamity. More importantly, I was shocked to hear that our own Tomas was actually a dark mage. I must reflect on our blindness.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: You surely must! You failed to notice that a rat was hiding in your home. Pathetic! Who are these wicked foes? How did Tomas escape your gaze?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Who are these villains?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Why did Tomas come to the monastery?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Tomas came to the monastery 40 years ago, by recommendation of House Ordelia of the Alliance. Around eight years ago he went back to House Ordelia before returning to the monastery once again just last year. After having worked at Garreg Mach for decades, why would he betray us now? Just what did he hope to accomplish? Jeritza became a professor at the Officers Academy because of a recommendation from the Imperial nobility. Supposing that he is the Death Knight, that means that our enemy is an organization that has taken root in at least two territories.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: In the long history of the Church of Seiros... No, long before even that... There have been an endless number of threats to the peace of Fódlan. Yet, those who oppose us still operate in the shadows, their identities a mystery. I believe that Solon and the Death Knight are merely one part of a much larger whole.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: A threat to Fódlan's peace? That means we have no choice. We have to stop them all!

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: What now?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Without knowing what their objective is, we cannot afford to act recklessly. The knights will investigate. For now, you and your class should focus on your training.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: They must be stopped.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: I have truly come to rely on you. I believe that the monastery will remain safe so long as we have you. We do not yet know the enemy's objective or whereabouts. For now, please devote yourself to preparing for whatever comes next.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: That is all for today.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: Professor. Please wait. I know there is much that you still do not understand. However, one thing is clear. You possess great power. I believe that you are destined to be a source of great hope for all. In any case, I expect great things from you. Walk this world proudly, dear Professor. May the goddess Sothis protect you.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: The goddess Sothis?! Is that what she just said?

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: Is something the matter?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: It's nothing.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: I see. In that case, farewell.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I had never heard the name of the goddess.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: I see. Sothis is the goddess's true name. Please do not use it carelessly. Farewell.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Do not say something that we may regret! She... I... What exactly am I? For now, let's leave this place. Please... Go!

flashback.speaker: Kingdom Soldier
flashback.line: Gah, the pain! Make the burning stop! Help me... Somebody...

flashback.speaker: Lambert
flashback.line: Avenge us! Those who killed us... Tear them apart! Destroy them all!
